Bibliography¶

AW90

Donald G Archer and Peiming Wang. The Dielectric Constant of Water and Debye Huckel Limiting Law Slopes. Journal of Physical and Chemical Reference Data, 19(2):371–411, 1990. URL: https://doi.org/10.1063/1.555853, doi:10.1063/1.555853.

BP79

Daniel J Bradley and Kenneth S Pitzer. Thermodynamics of Electrolytes. 12. Dielectric Properties of Water and Debye-Hiickel Parameters to 350 °C and 1 kbar. Journal of physical chemistry, 83(12):1599–1603, 1979. URL: https://doi.org/10.1021/j100475a009, doi:10.1021/j100475a009.

Dor02

Elena E Dormidontova. Role of Competitive PEO Water and Water Water Hydrogen Bonding in Aqueous Solution PEO Behavior. Macromolecules, 35(3):987–1001, jan 2002. URL: http://dx.doi.org/10.1021/ma010804e, doi:10.1021/ma010804e.

FE71

H Falkenhagen and W Ebeling. Equilibrium Properties of Ionized Dilute Electrolytes. In S Petrucci, editor, Ionic Interactions, volume 22 of Physical Chemistry. Academic Press, New York, 1971.

FM73

Rana A Fine and Frank J Millero. Compressibility of water as a function of temperature and pressure. The Journal of Chemical Physics, 59(10):5529–5536, 1973. URL: https://doi.org/10.1063/1.1679903, doi:10.1063/1.1679903.

LF96

Yan Levin and Michael E Fisher. Criticality in the hard-sphere ionic fluid. Physica A: Statistical and Theoretical Physics, 225(2):164–220, 1996. URL: http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/0378437195003363, doi:DOI: 10.1016/0378-4371(95)00336-3.

PP88

Roberto T Pabalan and Kenneth S Pitzer. Apparent molar heat capacity and other thermodynamic properties of aqueous potassium chloride solutions to high temperatures and pressures. Journal of Chemical and Engineering Data, 33(3):354–362, 1988. URL: https://pubs.acs.org/doi/abs/10.1021/je00053a037, doi:10.1021/je00053a037.

PP86

Ramesh C Phutela and Kenneth S Pitzer. Densities and apparent molar volumes of aqueous magnesium sulfate and sodium sulfate to 473 k and 100 bar. Journal of Chemical and Engineering Data, 31(3):320–327, 1986. URL: https://pubs.acs.org/doi/pdf/10.1021/je00045a018, doi:10.1021/je00045a018.

Pit73

Kenneth S. Pitzer. Thermodynamics of electrolytes. I. Theoretical basis and general equations. Journal of Physical Chemistry, 77(2):268–277, 1973. doi:10.1021/j100621a026.

RP82

P. S.Z. Rogers and Kenneth S. Pitzer. Volumetric Properties of Aqueous Sodium Chloride Solutions. Journal of Physical and Chemical Reference Data, 11(1):15–81, jan 1982. URL: http://aip.scitation.org/doi/10.1063/1.555660, doi:10.1063/1.555660.

SP77

Leonard F Silvester and Kenneth S Pitzer. Thermodynamics of electrolytes. 8. high-temperature properties, including enthalpy and heat capacity, with application to sodium chloride. The Journal of Physical Chemistry, 81(19):1822–1828, 1977. URL: https://pubs.acs.org/doi/pdf/10.1021/j100534a007.

WPS98

Peiming Wang, Kenneth S Pitzer, and John M Simonson. Thermodynamic properties of aqueous magnesium chloride solutions from 250 to 600 k and to 100 mpa. Journal of Physical and Chemical Reference Data, 27(5):971–991, 1998. URL: https://aip.scitation.org/doi/abs/10.1063/1.556026, doi:10.1063/1.556026.
